channel.title: JBoss Issue Tracker
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [ENTESB-4618] Dozer classloading may fail with spring based context
item.description:
If I try to deploy a project which contains dozer transformation (example is attached), the following error is occurred.

14:31:08,633 INFO  [org.jboss.as.server.deployment] (MSC service thread 1-2) JBAS015876: Starting deployment of "wildfly-camel-spring.jar" (runtime-name: "wildfly-camel-spring.jar")

JBAS014777:   Services which failed to start:      service jboss.deployment.unit."wildfly-camel-spring.jar".POST_MODULE
item.summary: Dozer classloading may fail with spring based context

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Maybe it is related to https://issues.jboss.org/browse/ENTESB-3427 and suggested patch at https://github.com/DozerMapper/dozer/pull/249 which is not applied in build 084

Assuming that deployment of wildfly-camel-spring.jar is supposed to show the issue, this seems to be out of date with the latest 2.4-redhat branch

09:22:55,391 INFO  [org.jboss.as] (Controller Boot Thread) JBAS015874: JBoss EAP 6.4.0.GA (AS 7.5.0.Final-redhat-21) started in 4915ms - Started 253 of 291 services (60 services are lazy, passive or on-demand)
 
09:23:55,493 INFO  [org.jboss.as.server.deployment] (MSC service thread 1-6) JBAS015876: Starting deployment of "wildfly-camel-spring.jar" (runtime-name: "wildfly-camel-spring.jar")
 
09:23:55,567 INFO  [org.jboss.as.server] (DeploymentScanner-threads - 1) JBAS015859: Deployed "wildfly-camel-spring.jar" (runtime-name : "wildfly-camel-spring.jar")

This issue is not fixed. I can reproduce it in both Fuse 6.2.1 GA and 6.2.1 R1 (build 90).

To reproduce this issue you have to modify reproducer. Add the following maven plugin because of the exception:

Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: org.apache.el.ExpressionFactoryImpl from [Module "deployment.wildfly-camel-spring.jar:main" from Service Module Loader]


<plugin>
 
   <groupId>org.apache.maven.plugins</groupId>
 
   <artifactId>maven-jar-plugin</artifactId>
 
   <version>2.6</version>
 
   <configuration>
 
      <archive>
 
         <manifestEntries>
 
            <Dependencies>org.jboss.as.web</Dependencies>
 
         </manifestEntries>
 
      </archive>
 
   </configuration>
 
</plugin>


mvn clean install
 
mvn wildfly:deploy

Dozer assumes that it can load user types from the classloader of the dozer implementation, which is of course quite wrong in a modular environment. In Camel we have a hack in DozerTypeConverterLoader, which prior to creating the bean mapper forces the classLoaderBeanName in GlobalSettings to DozerThreadContextClassLoader and then initialises the TCCL with the application ClassLoader associated with the CamelContext.

With a spring based context, this code path is not executed and therefore the application ClassLoader associated with the CamelContext not used.

Blocked on: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CAMEL-9545

As a workaround it may be possible to set 

org.dozer.util.DozerClassLoader = org.apache.camel.converter.dozer.DozerThreadContextClassLoader

in dozer.properties at the application level
Verified in Fuse 6.3 DR2 with provided reproducer.

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue:
1. run JBoss Fuse on EAP
  2. try to deploy the attached project
